definitions: a condition in which a tree or shrub begins to die from the tip of its leaves or roots backward, owing to disease or an unfavorable environment

examples.text: any sign of browning or other discoloration could be the onset of dieback
aluminum causes the stress condition of crown dieback
a survey of hedgerow trees found a correlation between ash dieback, acidity, and sulfur

shortDefinitions: condition in which tree or shrub begins to die from tip of its leaves
